content: The issue #D340 has some mockups to address issue of "Improve "Add Server" page for new users" . This thread is to discuss the design mockups.

@Akash Nimare In the current design, we can easily implement the part @Tim Abbott has suggested, i.e. link logo/name takes to that organization, and clicking the trash can removes it and change the text box with URL.

I'd recommend starting with that, and improving the page incrementally.
Given the amount of room, I'd also consider putting a button with a word (like ":wastebasket: Disconnect").

a button with a word (like ":wastebasket: Disconnect").

What'd be the purpose of this button?

oh, I just meant that instead of just having a :wastebasket:, also add a word.
The danger of having just the trash can icon is that we use "red trash icon" to mean "destructive action" everywhere else in Zulip.

Ideally actually we would just not use the trash can icon for this, and/or not make it red. Maybe something like https://fontawesome.com/icons/unlink?style=solid for the icon? Haven't looked very carefully; there might be better ones.
pasted image
I understand. However "Delete" would be more suitable than "Disconnect".

For list of organisations something like this can work. The color scheme need tweaking though. The way things are placed seems good.
mockup
Also the new mockup of @Akash Nimare of add-organization tab looks really good. Although the indentation suggestions by @Rishi Gupta are something to work on.
@Abhigyan Khaund I think "Delete" could be confused with deleting the organization (or your account). "Disconnect" is I think a lot clearer.

FWIW, one good source for pretty high-quality (and open source) icons is Google's Material Design set:
https://material.io/icons/
Nice! I'd say look in font awesome first, just because that's where the rest of our icons come from, but sometimes they won't have what we want, in which case using these could be good.
Reasonable!

I think the "unlink" icon above would probably not be clear to me, but in the Material set the three "remove" variants would be good (which one depends on the background), or "close".

Those are all pretty simple so there are probably close equivalents in font awesome.

The delete button looks bit noisy. I have tried to make the "Existing organization" section minimal (accidentally deleted the Add new server section)-
Screen-Shot-2018-03-05-at-9.27.07-PM.png

FWIW, one good source for pretty high-quality (and open source) icons is Google's Material Design set:
https://material.io/icons/

We are using the material icons currently :)
cool, no icon works as well. I think putting disconnect in a button could make sense? And moving it a bit to the right

^I agree.
Do we need the url though?
I think the URL is nice, and also gives the user a hint as to how to add further ones. Especially since we aren't tight on space.

Screenshot-from-2018-03-06-00-40-41.png
Looks good?
I think we don't need a filled in button here. I was imagining something similar to how we do buttons in the web app (e.g. the Reply or "New topic" button)
We could make the button a bit smaller here. There should be some space between the realm name and realm URL (float: left and right).

Few mockups for "Add server" page -
pasted image
mockups.png

@Akash Nimare good trick for better UI text (also writing) is: if you can remove a word and the meaning remains the same - do it.
'Welcome, before we get starterd, please register or login to a Zulip organization'.
Removing 'Welcome' and 'please' is almost always a no-brainer. The only time when UI necessitates pleasantries is when an error has occurred or a very inconvenient thing happened.
'Before we get started' also does not add any information.
So we are at 'Register or login to a Zulip organization' which sounds about right ;)
I would also not use 'Create' and 'Register' on the same page for the same thing. Pick either one of them.
(deleted)
Made some changes. servers.png

'Welcome, before we get started, please register or login to a Zulip organization'.

@Boris Yankov LGTM.

I would also not use 'Create' and 'Register' on the same page for the same thing. Pick either one of them.

Agreed. We could go with Register.

How about:
Sign up or log in to an existing organization as the header
and then add a label to the text box: Organization URL

The button can be: Next, since the "register" case is pretty common.

We're removing "register" from the zulip lexicon, and replacing it with "Sign up".
Create is for creating a new organization, which is different from signing up.

and then add a label to the text box: Organization URL

Do we really need to add a label here? I think our placeholder is pretty clear (it's very long though).

I agree the placeholder is too long; maybe your-organization should be changed to example or similar.

But I think that's independent of the label; I think we want this screen to be as easy to use as it can be.
mockup2.png

oh also, in this single page design, I think we do want the
----- OR ------
create a new organization

type design.

Also, "sign up or log in" is looking harder to parse than I had hoped. How about "Connect to an existing organization"?

Few more variations -
pasted image

How about "Add organization" instead of "Connect to an existing organization"?
Or maybe "Add a Zulip organization"

Hmm, maybe "Add a Zulip organization" -
pasted image

Don't feel the need to add titles and stuff. Anything that is obvious without it existing does not need to be there :)
Next button should become the action it performs, so Login or Connect.
OR is really not needed.
I did merge a new realm input to the mobile app, works like Slack's. You can test it in 1-2 days when I do the next release.

title - I do think we need the title here and if we decide to remove it then we gotta update the label to something like "Enter your organization URL". Also, we can afford the title etc as we have space there.
Next button - This could be named as "Connect".
OR - If we are using the button for "Create a new organization" then we should use it as a separator. If we decide to remove it then we need to turn that button into the small link I think.
I like having the OR there.
I agree calling it "Connect" seems potentially better than "Next"

Okay. For now, I'm locking the above design, we can always improve it later. The approach for improving the UX would be -

  • Add a separate page for "Add new server page"
  • Add a new tab for "Connected organizations" in setting page

A few small comments:

  • I would put a box around pasted image, to make it super visually clear that there are two separate things going on here (this, and the create a new org)
  • I think there's a bit too much vertical space between the Label and the input box

Otherwise looks great!
Also as followup, we should probably add a "Looking to run your own server?" link to zulipchat.com/new (or whatever the URL is), for people that click through and are confused to land on a page that's only for hosted zulips.

I think there's a bit too much vertical space between the Label and the input box

Yeah, this needs a finishing.

Also as followup, we should probably add a "Looking to run your own server?" link to zulipchat.com/new (or whatever the URL is), for people that click through and are confused to land on a page that's only for hosted zulips.

This could go in the bottom with just a link.

I did merge a new realm input to the mobile app, works like Slack's. You can test it in 1-2 days when I do the next release.

@Boris Yankov just checked it, pretty rad :tada:
@Boris Yankov I think we might want to change "you-organization.zulipchat.com" to be "example.zulipchat.com" -- currently it's too long.

@Tim Abbott Slack uses your-workspace.slack.com and I think this is one of the good ideas of that approach.
'example' is used very widely as a non-descript value in programming, but is never used in UI design.
Aren't we getting it shortened to .zulip.com soon?
I don't think it is long, but if you think it is, we can shorten it to organization which is better than example. But your-organization is way better, as it suggests a custom value, not the hardcoded organization.
How about your-org.zulipchat.com, for now? And yes, we should probably deal with shortening to zulip.com soon
But probably we won't have time to focus on that for a few weeks.

Do you mean the text might not fit in the screen, or is it just that you don't like the length?
I certainly prefer your-org to your other suggestions, but prefer your-organization to that.
Well it definitely didn't fit on my screen in a way that looked bad in the app (Galaxy Note 4 device). And also looks really long :)
So I suppose both :)
on mobile we're switching to something else though, right? Where we have a "Custom URL" button, and zulipchat.com is prefilled in?

@Rishi Gupta the thing we are discussing with Tim is already deployed, so we've switched.
It is a 'smart url input' that prefills all parts of the URL for you but removes them if you enter any of the parts

So by default it is https://your-organization.zulipchat.com but if you enter 'http://' it will replace the protocol, if you enter 'nasa' it will not fill in your-organization and if you start adding a different domain, it will remove any appended domain.
This is very similar to how Slack does it, but they don't do the additional logic for the domain, as they offer only hosted.
@Tim Abbott I'll change the organization placeholder to your-org but would want to return it to the longer one once we move to zulip.com whenever it happens. Sounds good?
seems reasonable to me!
